    • Method Detail

      • fileExists

        public static boolean fileExists​(SELECTive.SEObjectType ot)
        Checks if a file exists at the specified path. If it doesn't the function automatically creates the file. IMPORTANT! This function does take action if a file is not found, the boolean return is mainly there to check if file creation failed in the case it wasn't found. By calling this function a missing file will be created thus - in a sense - fixing the issue.
        Parameters:
        ot - the SEObjectType defining the type of the object to which to add an entry
        Returns:
        boolean indicating if the file exists after completion of this function

      • readInfoFile

        public static java.lang.String[][] readInfoFile​(SELECTive.SEObjectType ot,
                                                java.lang.String[] ids)
        Reads information from one of the DB files. Ensure you are passing a correct one, the method does not check the validity and assumes the caller knows what they are accessing. Otherwise a new file (and possibly directories) will be created, thus returning null
        Parameters:
        ot - the SEObjectType defining the type of the object to which to add an entry
        ids - a list of ids to check for as String. Pass null if you want all records returned
        Returns:
        String[][] representing an array of row (or observation) arrays

      • updateInfoFile

        public static boolean updateInfoFile​(SELECTive.SEObjectType ot,
                                     java.lang.String id,
                                     java.lang.String[] info)
        Updates a info file with the specified info. All info must be passed, even if only one property was changed since the function lazily overwrites the specific row. Order is preserved though. 
             The function uses a StringBuilder to create the string since this is used anyways implicitly when using
     String concatination (i.e. String z = (String)x + (String)y). This way one entery can be easily exchanged.
     The entire 'buffer' (the StringBuilder object instance) is then converted to a String and directly writes
     this to a temporary file  using the writer
        IMPORTANT: the info does not have to contain the id, the function checks if the first passed info element is the same as the defined id. If not then it will write this first followed by the info.
        Parameters:
        ot - the SEObjectType defining the type of the object to which to add an entry
        id - a String representing the id of the object to update
        info - a String[] defining the info of the object to write to the file
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the update occurred successful

      • addEntryToInfoFile

        public static long addEntryToInfoFile​(SELECTive.SEObjectType ot,
                                      java.lang.String[] infoToAdd)
        Adds an entry to the file returning the id assigned to the new entry. IMPORTANT: do NOT specifiy an id in the info, the function will delegate ids as necessary!
        Parameters:
        ot - the SEObjectType defining the type of the object to which to add an entry
        infoToAdd - a String[] representing the information - without the id - to store
        Returns:
        the assigned id as a long

        Parameters:
        title - the String representing the title to print
        c - a char from which to print the line

        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • stripWhitespace

        public static java.lang.String stripWhitespace​(java.lang.String str)
        Trips the whitespace that might be at the beginning or end of a string if a user does not use the exact separator + spacing as expected
        Parameters:
        str - the String to strip the whitespace of
        Returns:
        the String with whitespace removed at the beginning and the end

      • stripWhitespaceOfArray

        public static java.lang.String[] stripWhitespaceOfArray​(java.lang.String[] strArr)
        Applies the stripWhitespace(String str) to a String array
        Parameters:
        strArr - the String[] representing the Strings to strip
        Returns:
        a String[] where all String of the array have been stripped

      • printError

        public static void printError​(java.lang.String className,
                              java.lang.String function,
                              java.lang.String type,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Print an error
        Parameters:
        className - String defining the class in which the error occurred
        function - String defining in which function the error occurred for better debugging
        type - String defining the type of error usually used to define the exception that was caught
        message - String the additional message to print in order to further clarify things

      • printIssue

        public static void printIssue​(java.lang.String title,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Prints an issue or warning for the user. It is mainly meant to be informative to the user telling them about an issue
        Parameters:
        title - String the title of the issue to be shown
        message - String the message further describing the issue along with potential actions the user could take and or actions the system will take on behalf of the user due to certian conditions
